DataElement.preferredName: Breast Lobular Carcinoma In Situ Histologic Subtype Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Named histologic subtype of the primary LCIS.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Lobular Carcinoma In Situ Histologic Subtype
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A non-invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast characterized by a proliferation of monomorphic cells completely filling the lumina.  The overall lobular architecture is preserved.  It is frequently multifocal (90% in some series) and bilateral.  It seldom becomes invasive; however there is an increased risk of infiltrating ductal adenocarcinoma._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._A group forming a type within a larger type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A non-invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast characterized by a proliferation of monomorphic cells completely filling the lumina

Concepts.definition: A non-invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast characterized by a proliferation of monomorphic cells completely filling the lumina.  The overall lobular architecture is preserved.  It is frequently multifocal (90% in some series) and bilateral.  It seldom becomes invasive; however there is an increased risk of infiltrating ductal adenocarcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to histology.:Subtype; a group forming a type within a larger type.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A group forming a type within a larger type.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk UCSF ISPY-2 AI, released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  5-15-19 tt created for Breast surgical therapy module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the histologic image of a lesion which carries all the characteristic morphologic findings which are necessary to define this lesion.

Concepts.definition: A term that refers to the histologic image of a lesion which carries all the characteristic morphologic findings which are necessary to define this lesion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pleomorphic Lobular Breast Carcinoma In Situ

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pleomorphic Lobular Breast Carcinoma In Situ
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recently described aggressive subtype of classic lobular breast carcinoma in situ. It is characterized by the presence of neoplastic large cells with irregular nuclei and prominent single or multiple nucleoli.

Concepts.longName: Breast Pleomorphic Lobular Carcinoma In Situ
Concepts.definition: Breast lobular carcinoma in situ characterized by the presence of neoplastic large cells with marked nuclear pleomorphism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
